name: places/ChIJa9mUEgFZwokRp_ITmhqS8f4
formattedAddress: 131 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 131 Essex St, New York, NY 10002-2370, USA

originalText.text:
Love a good smashburger so was hype for this place. Came around 7 PM in the middle of the week and it was crowded but moving. All workers were friendly and helpful. Wait time from ordering to getting the food was 15-20 minutes. You might be sharing a table with strangers when it's packed.
Got the Gotham Smash double cheeseburger and it was great. Tots were good too. The place calmed down after 8 pm. Definitely recommend!

originalText.text:
She‚Äôs a winner üçî
üìç @gothamburgersocialclub

Smashed burgers are finally having their well-deserved moment in the spotlight. LES newest, and dare I say one of the top smash burgers as of late. The patties are thin and done crispy with onions piled on top- just how I like it. The burger comes fully dressed with fixings and do not forget the sides. The fried pickles and onion rings were a hot commodity.

originalText.text:
First things first Gotham Burgers uses martins buns!!!! The best for burgers buns üëèüèæüëèüèæI got the Gotham smash burger double came with American cheese house made pickles caramelize, onions I asked to not get the mustard and jalape√±o , that one burger cast me $11.98
Was it worth the money on a scale from 1 to 10 I give it a 8 service was good and my burger came fast . You can see the staff making your order
Great and fast pace environment there are bar seating and bar window seating,tables in the middle with out chairs for anyone in a rush to eat and go then there only a few booths
The menu is short and sweet they do offer french fries, tater tot‚Äôs  loaded tots , can beer , can cocktails and wine along with the fountain drinks.I will definitely check this place out again oh and not to mention I only ate half the burger and save the other half and I just slightly warm. Is it in the microwave and it still tasted as good as I got it!!!!!

originalText.text: Yes the burger is great (get the double) but the fried pickles and the ghost pepper ranch were incredible. The reason this is so amazing is because 1. I absolutely despise ranch, and 2. I normally would never order fried pickles. Whenever I‚Äôve had them they‚Äôve been unexceptional and kind of boring. Both of these items were the immediate stand outs to me. Again I think ranch dressing is absolute garbage and only because the owner told me to try it, I tried it and I loved it. Mainly it‚Äôs because it‚Äôs made fresh and the spiciness gives it a more bold flavor than other ranch dressings. The fried pickles had an exceptional crunch and flavor that made me want more. As far as the burger it‚Äôs exactly what you got at the pop ups, onion smash burger with a perfectly laced edge and tons of crunch and that umami rich meat flavor. Can‚Äôt wait to come back.

originalText.text:
TLDR: delicious burger for a very affordable price

We got there around 4:30PM and there‚Äôs a line about 15 minutes. We ordered three smash burgers, two hot dogs and one loaded tater tots. The smash burgers were tasty, the hot dogs looked a bit overcooked but pretty flavorful and the loaded tater tots were üî•

Glad to see the affordable back to basics approach to burger, nothing too fancy, just good old fashioned tasty smash burgers
